column4: Hello, I'm quite new to Linux.  Windows is my bread and butter.  I think I have a driver for my webcam but it is a .gz file.  Can anyone help me install it please?
.gz is a gzip file. uncompress it with gunzip <filename here>
Thank you, what should I be looking for for the installer?
that depends. there is no standard way, but there are some common ones
I'm assuming that you have a folder after you uncompress it?
yes I do
I'm going throught the 'ReadMe' now
and in that folder, do you have a .deb file? a setup.py file? a configure script and a Makefile?
the README is a great start :-)
I do have a Makefile
then the readme probably says do something like "./configure" then "make" then "sudo make install". am I right?
Yeah, but all it says is to run 'make install' and then to load the usb modules
I tried to run make install but the system tells me 'make: *** No rule to make target 'install'. Stop.
is there a Makefile in that folder?
OH, duh, I have to be in the folder...*V8*
I did the sudo -i command to get root, but I'm not sure how to find which folder to go into
the make command will look for a Makefile in the current directory. therefore you will need to be in the unzipped directory
Yup, I just don't know how to get ther from root
cd path/to/foler/or/file
thank you, and I do have to be logged in as sudo -i, correct?
no, you can just prefix the command you are running with sudo
ah
